result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is allowed to have Huber Bailee Status.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.

Case called at 1:37 PM 
Attorney Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Darlene M Spears. 
Defendant Darlene M Spears in court, in custody. 
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendant's waiver of prelim.
Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.
State files an Information. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waived reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court indicates that the bail is currently set at $750.00.
Defense requests that the court modify conditions to allow Huber Bailee Status.
State objects.
Court will allow the defendant to have Huber Bailee Status.
Next court date remains as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond;  filed by Atty. Aaron Anderson.  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-03-2022:  schedule for Wednesday afternoon.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Darlene M Spears appeared by phone, in custody at Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Darlene M Spears. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Atty. Gutierrez states he does not have any information on this case.  Defendant states she would like to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Court informs defendant if the proper forms are filled out at the next hearing she can waive her preliminary hearing.  Waiver of preliminary hearing and waiver of right to counsel were sent to the defendant by way of the jail.  Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:01 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Darlene M Spears appeared by phone, in custody at Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Darlene M Spears. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Anderson will be appointed. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:09 PM Defendant Darlene M Spears appeared by phone, in custody at the Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Darlene M Spears. Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office but defendant states Attorney Aaron Anderson was appointed by the Public Defenders office on her other cases. 
 Defendant states she does not have a current phone number.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Public Defenders office to evaluate the defendant prior to the next date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
